subject: Re: [junit] results
msgSnippet:
Hai ,
 thank u for helping me out.But I was asking a way by which the results can be generated and  be stored as a part of the testing code in junit itself.
messageBody:
Hai ,
thank u for helping me out.But I was asking a way by which the results can be generated and be stored as a part of the testing code in junit itself.
thank u again
suresh
> Simplest way (on Windows):
>
> java com.me.xxx.MyTestSuite >a_file
>
>
>
> More useful, arguably:
> Use ant & xalan, e.g.:
> <!-- the junit/cactus test definitions -->
> <target name="test_definitions">
> <junit
> printsummary="withOutAndErr"
> fork="no"
> haltonfailure="no">
> <formatter type="xml" />
> <test name="sinfo.utils.UtilsTestSuite" />
> <test name="sinfo.tm.TMTestSuite" />
> <test name="sinfo.pid.PIDTestSuite" />
> <test name="sinfo.rrm.RRMTestSuite" />
> <test name="sinfo.jsp.utils.JSPUtilsTestSuite" />
> <test name="sinfo.cache.CacheTestSuite" />
> <test name="sinfo.jsp.bv.BVTestSuite" />
> </junit>
> <junitreport todir="${test.results.dir}">
> <fileset dir="${src}" includes="TEST-*.xml"/>
> <report format="noframes" todir="${test.results.dir}"/>
> </junitreport>
> </target>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> --
>
> * Jim Cheesman *
> Trabajo:
> jchees@... - (34)(91) 724 9200 x 2360
> I disagree
> with unanimity.
>
>
